page.title: 07Whalley Abbey,Lancashire.
page.content: Whalley Abbey stands on the ancient site of a{cistercian monastery}which later fell into a private ownership of the{Assheton}family.It was regained by the church in{1923,}and by{Blackburn {Diocese}in{1927,}who now use it as their conference and retreat house. On the ground floor there is a chapel with a central altar,it seats up to{40}people.Besides the staff Eucharist every Friday morning most people who use the abbey use the { {chapel. { }The dining room seats 100,and accomodation for 42 people is in 24 bedrooms.There are 3 conference rooms/lounges and a library. Its outdoor facilities include picnic/barbecue area, flower gardens, wooded walk and fishing in the{River {Calder.}Outdoor services are still held at the altar of the Abbey ruins.
